content:
Diagnosis
	1. Metaplastic breast carcinoma with chondroid differentiation
	Date of diagnosis
	January 2024

	Treatment aim
	Palliative

	Summary of completed treatment and relevant dates

	Surgery
	Not appropriate - T4 disease at presentation

	Chemotherapy
	1. Jan-Mar 2024: 3 cycles carboplatin/gemcitabine
	2. Apr 2024: Single agent weekly paclitaxel

	Radiotherapy
	1. Mar 2024: Whole brain radiotherapy 20Gy in 5#
	2. Apr 2024: Palliative radiotherapy to T7 vertebra 8Gy single fraction

	Current disease status
	Progressive disease in liver, bone, and brain

	Current issues
	1. Deteriorating mobility and performance status
	2. Increasing liver pain
	3. Confusion and headaches

	Summary of consultation
	Unfortunately [redacted name] has experienced significant clinical deterioration over the past 2 weeks. Her liver metastases have progressed on imaging with corresponding rise in LFTs (ALT 156, ALP 432). She reports worsening right upper quadrant pain requiring increased opioid doses. Her confusion has worsened despite completed whole brain radiotherapy, with new onset headaches suggesting possible cerebral disease progression. Performance status has declined to ECOG 3.

On examination today, she is confused (abbreviated mental test 6/10) with right upper quadrant tenderness and hepatomegaly. There is reduced air entry at right lung base. She requires wheelchair assistance.

Given her declining performance status and disease progression on two lines of chemotherapy, I have had a detailed discussion with [redacted name] and her family about focusing on symptom control. We have agreed to discontinue systemic anti-cancer therapy.

	Further investigations
	None indicated

	Medication changes
	1. Increased MST to 60mg BD
	2. Added dexamethasone 4mg BD
	3. Commenced cyclizine 50mg TDS

	Follow up
	1. Urgent referral to palliative care team
	2. Hospital palliative care review tomorrow
	3. No further oncology follow-up planned

	Required GP actions
	Please support palliative care in community

	Information given to patient
	Discussed disease progression and transition to palliative care approach with patient and family. Written information provided about local hospice services.
